position: Intern - Business Analyst - Summer 2022 - Remote or Nationwide
description: **ABOUT LUMEN** Lumen is guided by our belief that humanity is at its best when technology advances the way we live and work. With 450,000 route fiber miles serving customers in more than 60 countries, we deliver the fastest, most secure global platform for applications and data to help businesses, government and communities deliver amazing experiences. Learn more about Lumen’s network, edge cloud, security and communication and collaboration solutions and our purpose to further human progress through technology at news.lumen.com, LinkedIn: /lumentechnologies, Twitter: @lumentechco, Facebook: /lumentechnologies, Instagram: @lumentechnologies and YouTube: /lumentechnologies. **THE ROLE** Lumen’s Internship Program is a path for career readiness in the 4th Industrial Revolution.  Be a part of an internship program, driving human progress through technology.  During a 10- week period our summer interns innovate and make an impact by transforming industries across the globe and changing the world one connection at a time.  Our interns are presented with real business challenges and provide solutions that make a difference across all areas of the company, all while learning the skills needed to successfully navigate the modern workplace. Interns will connect to our company culture through community outreach projects, engage with our employee resource groups and be able to develop their professional skills and business acumen through frequent exposure to senior leadership, cutting-edge technology, groundbreaking projects, and a network of mentors and fellow interns. Come Intern with us and create the beginnings of a career right for YOU!  The Experience  •    Innovate – to deliver solutions to real business problems  •    Transform – your skills and knowledge through challenging work projects •    Connect – to our company and culture creating valuable connections with your intern peers, work team and leaders across the organization. •    Impact – through Community & Social Involvement – collaborate with our ERGs to give back and make an impact in the communities Lumen serves.   **THE MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES** As a Business Analyst Intern in our North America Operations organization, you will work collaboratively with our automation operations team to handle automation opportunities across the business and within North American Operations. Tasks during the 10 weeks will have impact on the business through the process of Review, approve, plan, document and implement automation opportunities for NAO. Business Analyst interns will have the potential to create and improve our processes through data research and solution suggestions. The ideal intern will have technical skills with common languages in the industry.  You will need a high level of engagement and ability to take initiative, ask questions and work in a team environment. - Responsible for conducting or assisting in the documentation of simple to moderate business analysis projects under direct supervision - Works with other team members and subject matter experts to resolve certain questions that are received - Responsible for understanding source data structures and models, producing raw data, data mining, data compilation, completing a variety of analyses (many times using disparate data sources), and creating effective presentations to answer the complex questions posed by the business - Communication expertise, process documentation, exploration, and requirements gathering jobs - Scheduling and hosting business meetings with other team members and business clients as necessary - Producing meeting notes after the call to all stakeholders   **WHAT WE LOOK FOR IN A CANDIDATE** Education Requirements  -      Enrolled at a 4-year accredited college or university, rising senior level education status at the start of the internship, graduating August 2022 – May 2023. -   Major/Degree: In pursuit of degree in Business, Finance, Management, Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field Proficiency and understanding of:  - Strong Microsoft Suite knowledge -    Reporting/data expertise is a plus  -    Conduct detailed data analysis and develops reports Microsoft Office suite (Excel with Analysis Toolpack functions, pivot and chart wizards; PowerPoint; Word; Access; Project) and other reporting and data analysis tools -    PowerBI experience is a plus  -    SQL writing expertise is a plus -    Jira/Confluence is a plus      Professional Attributes -        Strong drive for results and taking initiative -    Attention to detail with good organizational capabilities.  -    Ability to prioritize with good time management skills. -    Solid understanding of a particular technology discipline and is proactive in seeking out learning opportunities. -    Good problem-solving skills and ability to methodically work through complex issues. -    Curious Minded- must be able to question the norm -    Ability to take direction and produce results from it -    Ability to be inquisitive, critical thinking, and adaptable -    Ability to collaborate and have agility while making effective decisions -    Excellent ability to effectively generate cross-departmental cooperation between operational groups, business product units, process and systems professionals. -    Exceptional ability to develop successful relationships at all levels in a professional, diligent and courteous manner.  -    Strong written and verbal communication skills  Work Setting -    Ideally the position will be in one of the following offices: Remote- Work From Home -    Intern must be able to work 30-40 hours be week during the 10-week program (June – August) -    Intern must have reliable transportation to/from work location (Lumen does not provide transportation to/from Lumen office locations)   **WHAT TO EXPECT NEXT** After completion and submission of your application, you will be asked to participate in a virtual video interview. This on demand interview will be a way for Lumen to learn more about you and your experience as it aligns to the internship position.  A separate email invitation will be sent to you (check your spam) within 6 hours of application.  For continued consideration in the summer internship program, please ensure you complete the video interview within 5 business days of application.  Thank you! We do not tolerate unlawful discrimination in any employment decisions, including recruiting, hiring, compensation, promotion, benefits, discipline, termination, job assignments or training. **DISCLAIMER** The above job definition information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.  Job duties and responsibilities are subject to change based on changing business needs and conditions.

position: Biological Technician - U.S. Military Veterans Only
description:
U.S. Military Veterans! Are you interested in starting a career with the U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service? Keep reading to learn more about this great veteran-only (paid) internship opportunity.

Position Summary: In partnership with the Mt. Adams Institute (MAI), the Columbia River Gorge National Fish Hatchery Complex will sponsor a VetsWork AmeriCorps Intern to serve as a Biological Science Technician. The position will assist with all aspects of salmon production at the Little White Salmon National Fish Hatchery. The primary function of this facility is to collect adult salmon, spawn and rear them for release each year. The salmon are a vital resource for a tribal and recreational fishery as well as a large contribution to the commercial ocean fishery. Our purpose is to replace salmon that were lost due to diminished spawning habitat upon completion of the Bonneville Dam 1938. Every job the Intern will perform contributes to the success of this facility and its ability to provide salmon for harvest. The Columbia River Gorge National Fish Hatchery Complex consists of six facilities, and there will be opportunities to assist each facility as needed.

Member Benefits Include:

Monthly AmeriCorps living stipend
Free housing
AmeriCorps education award
Student loan forbearance
Basic medical insurance (covers members only; vision and dental not included).
Child care allowance for those who qualify.
Access to G.I. Bill benefits of up to approximately $2,400 per month. Actual benefits vary by individuals’ qualified benefits.
Professional development, trainings, certifications and networking opportunities.

Essential Functions (to include, but not limited to):

· Providing standard feeds to fish according to specific schedules following established protocols.

· Observing fish to monitor their behavior and appearance for signs of stress or disease.

· Cleaning and maintaining fish raceways.

· Spawning adult fish.

· Transporting/transferring eggs and fish.

· Grounds maintenance to include improvement projects (use of some power tools, yard work, painting).

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:

Service Site - Spring Creek National Fish Hatchery

Comply with all Partner Organizations safety policies and procedures.
Must have a valid driver's license, clean driving record and ability to provide documentation.
Willingness to communicate with the public.
Ability and willingness to serve outdoors in inclement weather with possible strenuous and repetitive physical activity and ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
Demonstrate attention to detail when collecting and recording data.
Demonstrate a desire to promote environmental stewardship.

AmeriCorps

· Must have served in US Armed Forces and have a DD214 with an honorable discharge.

· At least 21 years of age at beginning of service term.

· U.S. citizen, national or lawful permanent resident.

· Possession of a high school diploma or equivalent, or commit to earning one prior to receiving education award.

· Ability to commit to the full 45-week term of service.

· Selection, placement and retention are contingent upon passing the National Sex Offender Public Registry, state of service and state of residence criminal history check and a national FBI check.

COVID-19 Policy - Selected applicants will be required to follow the policies at their service site including any changes that are implemented throughout the course of the program. These policies may include vaccination or regular testing mandates (federal sites), masking / social distancing mandates, remote / virtual work, altered field duties and other restrictions determined necessary to keep site staff, partners and the public safe. Accepting a position means accepting the current requirements and any updates to those requirements while you are enrolled in the program.

position: USDA-ARS Postdoctoral Fellowship in Insect Ecology
description:
*Applications may be reviewed on a rolling-basis and this posting could close before the deadline.

ARS Office/Lab and Location: A research opportunity is currently available with the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA), Agricultural Research Service (ARS), Tropical Crop and Commodity Protection Research Unit located in Hilo, Hawaii.

The Agricultural Research Service (ARS) is the U.S. Department of Agriculture's chief scientific in-house research agency with a mission to find solutions to agricultural problems that affect Americans every day from field to table. ARS will deliver cutting-edge, scientific tools and innovative solutions for American farmers, producers, industry, and communities to support the nourishment and well-being of all people; sustain our nation’s agroecosystems and natural resources; and ensure the economic competitiveness and excellence of our agriculture. The vision of the agency is to provide global leadership in agricultural discoveries through scientific excellence.

Research Project: In support of the overall mission of the Tropical Crop and Commodity Protection Research unit, the postdoctoral fellow will pursue research and training related to the development and enhancement of sustainable pest monitoring and management strategies against key arthropod pests of macadamia nuts in Hawaii, including but not limited, to macadamia felted coccid (MFC), Cryptophlebia spp. and tropical nut borer (TNB). The development of these management strategies hinges upon a good understanding of insect behavior and ecology. Thus, the planned postdoctoral research may include activities pertaining to the identification of the sex pheromone of MFC, assessment of volatiles attractive to Cryptophlebia spp. spp and TNB.

Learning Objectives: The specific training activities will include participation in experimental design, set-up of behavioral and chemical ecology lab bioassays (e.g., volatile collection, EthoVision, olfactometer), conducting field experiments, data collection and analysis. The postdoctoral fellow will be given opportunities to showcase research findings to stakeholders via grower meetings, and to scientific audiences through professional conferences (e.g., ESA National Meeting, ESA Branch Meeting, Hawaiian Entomological Society). In addition, the fellow will have opportunities to publish research findings in peer-reviewed journals. The postdoctoral participant will gain valuable experience in interacting with growers, extension specialist and agents, and collaborate with other research scientists working in similar study systems. Overall, this postdoctoral fellowship will offer enhanced scientific and analytical skills for lab and field-based experiments; and provide opportunities for collaborative research and valuable research experience in insect ecology and IPM involving perennial orchard cropping systems.

Mentor(s): The mentor for this opportunity is Angelita Acebes-Doria (Angelita.acebes-doria@usda.gov). If you have questions about the nature of the research please contact one of the mentors.

Anticipated Appointment Start Date: February 2022.  Start date is flexible and will depend on a variety of factors.

Appointment Length: The appointment will initially be for one year, but may be renewed upon recommendation of ARS and is contingent on the availability of funds.

Level of Participation: The appointment is full-time.

Participant Stipend: The participant will receive a monthly stipend commensurate with educational level and experience. A relocation allowance will also be provided to the selected candidate to offset the costs associated with relocating to Hilo, Hawaii.

Citizenship Requirements: This opportunity is available to U.S. citizens, Lawful Permanent Residents (LPR), and foreign nationals. Non-U.S. citizen applicants should refer to the Guidelines for Non-U.S. Citizens Details page of the program website for information about the valid immigration statuses that are acceptable for program participation.

ORISE Information: This program, administered by ORAU through its contract with the U.S. Department of Energy (DOE) to manage the Oak Ridge Institute for Science and Education (ORISE), was established through an interagency agreement between DOE and ARS. Participants do not become employees of USDA, ARS, DOE or the program administrator, and there are no employment-related benefits. Proof of health insurance is required for participation in this program. Health insurance can be obtained through ORISE.

Questions: Please visit our Program Website. After reading, if you have additional questions about the application process please email USDA-ARS@orau.org and include the reference code for this opportunity.
company: Oak Ridge Institute for Science and Education

This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military environments to a 3M career. Here, you will make an impact by: + Addressing relevant business concerns through both individual and team-oriented projects + Participating in a highly developed new employee roundtable connecting you with numerous events and networks + Taking advantage of initial and ongoing training opportunities and exposure to senior leadership Assignment Areas include: + Business Finance Counsel: Assigned responsibility for a business segment, product line, plant, or staff organization to provide business counsel, analysis and financial recommendations. + Auditing: Assigned to one or more auditing teams to perform audits in specific organizations or audit process improvement projects. + Business Accounting: Assigned projects to improve global financial accounting processes or assigned responsibility for a process or business segment to provide accurate, efficient and timely financial reporting, analysis and participate in process standardization. + Treasury: Specific projects to assess and make recommendations on investment or risk management strategies. + Plant Analyst Center: Assigned projects to analyze a given improvement opportunity in US Plant Financial Analyst Center that would either create, standardize or optimize processes or reporting for US plant financial support. + Insights & Analytics: Apply programming skills and advanced statistical modelling techniques to large quantities of data to deliver insights into major finance questions and problems. + Other: Assignments in Tax or Corporate Accounting. Supporting Your Well-being 3M offers many programs to help you live your best life - both physically and financially. work:

Our school is in Tokyo, we sponsor visas!

We are focused on creative thinking, so if you are a creative person and have an interest in art, music, math, English or technology... welcome to our team.

We offer group lessons using active learning techniques in various subjects that include subject areas like design, entertainment, math, programming and other academic courses.
Class sizes are approximately 10-16 person class.
Making activities and lesson plans.
Making school event plans and leading school events.
Supporting school management.
Be a role model and to display an appropriate behavior at all times.
Take part in our company’s development project.
Take part in our company’s internal project.

what you're looking for:

Having a positive attitude and commitment towards your work.
Have creativity towards making unique activities and lesson plans.　
Leadership and willingness to be a leader.
Interested in English education and communication with different kinds of people especially kids.
Programming knowledge is not necessary, but if you have it, it is a big plus.
Knowledge about IB, design, music, dance, science or math is a plus.
Be passionate, energetic, hard working, and have a can do attitude.

アピールポイント:

If selected we can help with any visa sponorship and housing needs.

Monday-Saturday

It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing! We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business. Summary amp; Key Responsibilities The IT Senior Apprenticeship is a paid 2-3 semester work and learn model that combines college curriculum with part-time paid employment with our partner school. At the end of the program, students walk away with an associate degree, paid work experience and enhanced technical skills. The apprentice will assist with various projects, activities, and events within the IT Client Services team and will have the opportunity to learn about many different functions of State Auto and Insurance. Key Responsibilities: * Field inbound calls from State Auto associates. * Build, Image, Configure workstations. * Assist Deskside with hardware and software deployments and collection. * Investigate, diagnose, and remediate hardware/software incidents. * Manage work queue within ServiceNow. * Assist Client Engineering with monthly patch testing. Qualifications Minimum Experience/Education Working to obtain a degree from an accredited two year college, with some analytical studies in Information Technology, Data Science, Statistics, Engineering, or other related disciplines. Ability to work 20-30 hours per week. Experience in basic workstation troubleshooting. Ability to address problems and provide solutions is a critical competency for the IT apprentice. For benefit eligible associates, State Auto offers a competitive salary, an annual bonus program, an excellent benefit program including medical, dental, vision and prescription insurance coverage, life insurance, matching 401(k) plan, flexible spending accounts, tuition assistance, and a stock purchase plan. State Auto is committed to the principal of equal employment opportunity for all associates and applicants and to providing associates with a work environment that is free from discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions (hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and work assignments) are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. State Auto will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. State Auto is a smoke-free work environment. We utilize background checks as a condition of employment. For all exempt positions we also obtain motor vehicle reports (MVR s). State Auto will not accept candidates from third-party recruiters without a signed agreement with State Auto. Sound engineering technicians typically do the following:

Operate, monitor, and adjust audio, video, lighting, and broadcast equipment to ensure consistent quality

Synchronize sounds and dialogue with action taking place on television or in movie productions
Convert video and audio records to digital formats for editing on computers
Install audio, video, and lighting equipment in hotels, offices, and schools
Report any problems that arise with complex equipment and make routine repairs
Keep records of recordings and equipment used

We are looking for a .Net Developer to build software using languages and technologies of the .NET framework. You will create applications from scratch, configure existing systems and provide user support.

In this role, you should be able to write functional code with a sharp eye for spotting defects. You should be a team player and excellent communicator. If you are also passionate about the .NET framework and software design/architecture, we’d like to meet you.

Your goal will be to work with internal teams to design, develop and maintain software.

Responsibilities

Participate in requirements analysis
Collaborate with internal teams to produce software design and architecture
Write clean, scalable code using .NET programming languages
Test and deploy applications and systems
Revise, update, refactor and debug code
Improve existing software
Develop documentation throughout the software development life cycle (SDLC)
Serve as an expert on applications and provide technical support

Who We Are

National Research Group (NRG) is a leader in data driven insights and strategic consultation to the global technology and entertainment industries. Working at the confluence of technology, content, and culture, NRG offers bold insights for storytellers everywhere. Our consultants have experience working across all facets of technology and media.

Why You'll Love It Here

We are inspired by working with storytellers that challenge us to think differently and see the world in new ways. As a result, our business is driven by creative, curious, and inventive people who have a passion for culture and technology. We work as a collective across disciplines and geographies to bring together the best thinking for every assignment, delivering insights to bold storytellers everywhere.

The Opportunity

We are seeking a Vice President or Senior Vice President to join our Platforms & Technology Practice to lead and grow a team focused on User Experience Research In this role, you will have the opportunity to help establish and grow a new practice area within NRG's Platforms & Technology team, building on our strong understanding of the technology space, deep existing relationships with many leading technology companies, and proven abilities in telling data-driven stories that help clients transform their businesses. In this role, you will shape the vision for NRG's unique value proposition and capabilities in the User Experience Research space, and help grow the team and client base to support it.

You will bring your intellectual curiosity, entrepreneurial mindset, and storytelling ability to lead the team, and consultatively engage with clients. If you're passionate about User Experience Research; if you want the innovate how research is done in this space; if you are excited about the opportunity to shape the product design strategies of the world's largest technology companies; if you possess a natural ability to visualize data and bring it to life; if you enjoy being a trusted consultant to technology clients – this opportunity is for you!

The Role

Launch and set the vision for a team that will deliver best-in-class, highly consultative User Experience Research, while disrupting traditional approaches to research in this space.
Provide account development, management, and team leadership for our business focused on User Experience Research, with leading technology and platform clients.
Lead team execution and timely delivery on all aspects of primary User Experience research, including both qualitative and quantitative methods, with a strong emphasis on delivering innovative insights and results with impact.
Develop, grow, and manage relationships with clients, focusing on leading technology clients and other forward-looking companies across industries. Previous experience with technology clients is important, and preference is for an existing network of contacts that can be leveraged, alongside NRG's existing relationships.
Coach, manage, motivate, and inspire a team of exceptional researchers to deliver best in class research programs, and continue to build out an extraordinary team via adept talent identification and recruitment.
Anticipate client needs through intimate familiarity with their business, their unique challenges/opportunities.
Proactively engage with clients on a continual basis to help foster a sense of partnership and to generate business opportunity.
Work collaboratively with the larger data processing / data sciences / development teams to constantly optimize and develop products, service models, and execution. Maintain a constant emphasis on improvement and innovation in order to demonstrate lasting value.
Serve as a trusted expert in technology and other trends impacting clients' business, staying abreast of product, service, and competitive developments.

Who You Are

8+ years' experience working in a relevant User Experience Research field, at a supplier side firm, or in a UXR role at a media/technology company (ideally some combination thereof.)
Degree-level qualification with a strong academic record, ideally in a field such as business, marketing, market research or social science.
Excellent PowerPoint, Excel, and written and visual communication skills.
Strong interest and experience in technology and social media.
Passionate about data-driven approach and can think strategically to draw out big picture correlations, predictions, and recommendations.
Strong storytelling and data visualization capabilities.
Ability to drive thought leadership research to help build NRG's profile as a trusted and innovative research provider in the UXR space.

Ideal Candidate

This is an end-to-end leadership role, but strong business/account development background is imperative, along with well-developed research acumen.
The optimal candidate will bring a portfolio of client relationships, along with leveraging NRG's existing client network.
Internally-motivated self-starter who continuously strives to get things done, regardless of challenges encountered.
Critical thinker, able to respond to complex questions from clients and lead the development of research plans, and deliver game-changing insights.
Team player who is able to work collaboratively.
Passion for research and, in particular, custom UXR projects, in multiple areas of specialization/across the product and services lifecycle.
Upholding and showing leadership around NRG's core values of excellence, innovation, collaboration, enthusiasm, and grit.

Position Type

This position is potentially responsible for supervising 1-10 Interns, Analysts, Managers, and/or Directors. This is a team leadership role and is a full-time exempt position

Work Environment

NRG provides flexible work options – employees will be given the choice to work remotely, work out of a designated office (Culver City or New York) or a hybrid of the two. This role routinely uses standard office equipment.

Required Application Materials:

Resume
Cover Letter which should include:
What excites you most about this position
What should excite NRG most about you, as a candidate for this position

The Opportunity

We are looking for a passionate certified Data Analyst. The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions. The Program is classified as UNPAID and is for learning practical hands-on experience in a professional business setting leading to marketable skills. A self-investing benefit for competing during job searches and future interviews.

Duties & Responsibilities

Data analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities, and design. Data analysts will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.

Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide ongoing reports
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and “clean” data by reviewing computer reports, printouts, and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities

Who We Are

National Research Group (NRG) is a leader in data driven insights and strategic consultation to the global technology and entertainment industries. Working at the confluence of technology, content, and culture, NRG offers bold insights for storytellers everywhere. Our consultants have experience working across all facets of technology and media.

Why You'll Love It Here

We work as a collective across disciplines and geographies to bring together the best thinking for every assignment, delivering insights to bold storytellers everywhere

The Opportunity

We are seeking a Vice President or Senior Vice President to join our Platforms & Technology Practice to lead and grow a team focused on corporate reputation, public affairs and advocacy research. In this role, you will have the opportunity to help grow an exciting practice area, building on the Platforms & Technology's strong understanding of the technology space, strong existing relationships with many leading technology companies, and proven abilities in telling data-driven stories that help clients transform their businesses. You will be responsible for shaping the vision for NRG's unique value proposition and capabilities in the corporate reputation space, providing overall direction and leadership to our client services team on corporate reputation and helping to grow the team and client base to support it.

You will bring your intellectual curiosity, entrepreneurial mindset, and storytelling ability to lead the team, and consultatively engage with clients. If you're passionate about corporate reputation, public affairs and advocacy research; if you want to innovate how research is done in this space; if you are excited about the opportunity to shape the communications strategies of the world's largest technology companies; if you possess a natural ability to visualize data and bring it to life; if you enjoy being a trusted consultant to technology clients – this opportunity is for you!

The Role

Provide account development, management, and team leadership for our business focused on corporate reputation, public affairs and advocacy research, with a focus on leading technology and platform clients.
Help set the vision for a team that will deliver best-in-class, highly consultative corporate reputation, public affairs, and advocacy research, while disrupting traditional approaches to research in this space.
Lead team execution and timely delivery on all aspects of primary corporate reputation research, including both qualitative and quantitative methods, with a strong emphasis on delivering innovative insights and results with impact.
Develop, grow, and manage relationships with clients, focusing on leading technology clients and other forward-looking companies across industries. Previous experience with technology clients is important, and preference is for an existing network of contacts that can be leveraged, alongside NRG's existing relationships.
Coach, manage, motivate, and inspire a team of exceptional researchers to deliver best in class programs, and continue to build out an extraordinary team via adept talent identification and recruitment.
Anticipate client needs through intimate familiarity with their business, and their unique challenges/opportunities
Proactively engage with clients on a continual basis to help foster a sense of partnership and to generate business opportunity.
Work collaboratively with the larger data processing / data sciences / development teams to constantly optimize and develop products, service models, and execution. Maintain a constant emphasis on improvement and innovation in order to demonstrate lasting value.
Serve as a trusted expert in technology and other trends impacting clients' business, staying abreast of product, service, and competitive developments.

Who You Are

8+ years' experience working in consumer insights, consumer research, or in an analyst/strategy role at a media/technology company (ideally some combination thereof, but supplier side experience a must.)
Degree-level qualification with a strong academic record, ideally in a field such as business, marketing, market research or social science.
Excellent PowerPoint, Excel, and written and visual communication skills.
Experience with the following data analysis techniques: statistical significance testing, correlations analysis, multivariate analysis techniques (such as cluster/segmentation analysis) and conjoint and discrete choice analysis. Ability to apply techniques a plus, but not required.
Strong interest and experience in corporate reputation, public affairs, and/or advocacy research.
Strong interest and experience in technology and social media.
Passionate about data-driven approach and can think strategically to draw out big picture correlations, predictions, and recommendations.
Strong storytelling and data visualization capabilities.
Ability to drive thought leadership research to help build NRG's profile as a trusted and innovative research provider in the corporate reputation, public affairs and advocacy research space.

Ideal Candidate

This is an end-to-end leadership role, but strong business/account development background is imperative, along with well-developed research acumen.
The optimal candidate will bring a portfolio of client relationships, along with leveraging NRG's existing client network.
Internally-motivated self-starter who continuously strives to get things done, regardless of challenges encountered.
Critical thinker, able to respond to complex questions from clients and lead the development of research plans, and deliver game-changing insights.
Team player who is able to work collaboratively.
Passion for research and, in particular, custom projects, in multiple areas of specialization/across the product and services lifecycle.
Upholding and showing leadership around NRG's core values of excellence, innovation, collaboration, enthusiasm, and grit.

Position Type

This position is potentially responsible for supervising 1-10 Interns, Analysts, Managers, and/or Directors. This is a team leadership role and is a full-time exempt position.

Work Environment

NRG provides flexible work options – employees will be given the choice to work remotely, work out of a designated office (Culver City or New York) or a hybrid of the two. This role routinely uses standard office equipment.

Required Application Materials:

Resume
Cover Letter which should include:
What excites you most about this position
What should excite NRG most about you, as a candidate for this position

(Funded 1-yr position giving priority to applicants of color)

Conservation Law Foundation (CLF) invites applicants for its Charlotte E. Ray Legal Fellowship. CLF’s Charlotte E. Ray Legal Fellowship is a one-year fellowship that honors the memory of Charlotte E. Ray, a trailblazer and Howard University graduate who became the first African American female lawyer in 1872. This position is ideal for third-year law students, judicial clerks, or recent law school graduates.

Priority will be given to racially and ethnically diverse applicants. Candidates with a commitment to environmental advocacy or social justice are encouraged to apply.

CLF has worked to protect New England’s environment for the benefit of all people and future generations since 1966. CLF’s advocacy spans topics including climate change, environmental justice, clean oceans and water, healthy forests, and local food systems.

The Charlotte E. Ray Legal Fellowship offers new or recently barred lawyers an opportunity to serve as an attorney at one of the country’s oldest and most respected non-profit environmental advocacy organizations. The term of this position is one year, with the possibility of becoming an Associate Attorney at the end of that year. CLF may hire one or two Charlotte E. Ray Legal Fellows. The Legal Fellow(s) will be located either in our Boston headquarters or in one of CLF’s other offices in Montpelier, VT, Concord, NH, Portland, ME or Providence, RI, with some flexibility to work remotely within New England. Legal Fellow(s) will interact with attorneys across all of CLF’s offices and programs, with an ultimate focus on one or two specific programs.

Applicants must have excellent legal advocacy and writing skills and be interested in building effective working relationships with community organizations and government agencies.

CLF offers a competitive salary, an extensive benefits plan, and an open, inclusive, and accepting work environment where differences are highly respected. The base salary for this position is $51,750 for Boston-based Fellows and $45,000 for those based in other New England states; actual salary will reflect experience and qualifications.

For more information about the work of Conservation Law Foundation, visit www.clf.org. Applicants should send a resume and cover letter to careers@clf.org. Please make “CER Legal Fellow” the subject of your e-mail.

CLF considers the health and safety of its staff members and their families, our guests, our visitors, and the community at large to be a top priority. All offers to work, intern, or volunteer with CLF are conditioned on the candidate complying with CLF’s mandatory COVID-19 vaccination policy.

Conservation Law Foundation (CLF) protects New England’s environment for the benefit of all people and future generations. A non-profit, member-supported organization, CLF uses the law, science, and the markets to create solutions that preserve and restore our natural resources, build healthy and resilient communities, and sustain a vibrant economy. Every day, CLF advocates work for and with New Englanders—in state houses, court houses and board rooms, regulatory hearings and community gatherings—to forge innovative paths to environmental progress and economic prosperity for all in our region. To that end, CLF works with communities of color, and also communities that are economically or otherwise disadvantaged, which often suffer disproportionately the impacts of environmental degradation and health burdens.

A Video Editor, or Video Production Editor, is responsible for reviewing audio and visual footage and using computer software to organize clips into a cohesive unit. Their duties include splitting or combining video clips, adding appropriate sounds or graphics and watching the finished product to catch mistakes before submitting it for review.

You will receive mentorship from our talented computer vision engineering team and contribute to our research and development of the AI, Perception and Robotics stack. It is a great opportunity to learn and to apply your knowledge to make an impact in the real world.

position: Live and Online Music Shows Programing and production intern
description:
youbloom seeks an intern to assist with all aspects of its online and offline shows programming. In this position the intern will develop the practical skills required to work in a live and online emerging and independent artist/band performing organization, and will have a chance to explore and work on all aspects of event curation, production and execution. Interns gain experience in project management A&R, artist/manager liaison and work closely with youbloom local promoter CityReps as well as with the youbloom Cities team.. The intern will be actively engaged in the planning and implementation of live and online shows. This is a valuable opportunity for someone interested in working in the live music industry.

youbloom works with interns to tailor their experience, providing projects and tasks that speak directly to the intern’s interest, while also working to support the general mission of youbloom.

Tasks will be assigned in the following areas:

Shows

provide logistical and hands on support to Program team in execution of live and online shows.
organize, read and discuss incoming show submissions from CityReps.
liaise with the A&R team.
assist in the set up of shows.
provide general office and administrative support, including answering phones, data entry and responding to emails.

Qualifications

Candidates should have an interest in emerging and independent artists/bands and live music.
Intern must be motivated to work quickly and independently.
Demonstrated research and organizational skills.
Ability to work independently or take direction from several members of a team, as needed.
Familiarity with a range of computer programs, including G suite.
Experience or interest in learning how live and online music shows work.

The intern term is 3 to 6 months. This is a non-paid internship, with flexible hours (minimum of 16 hours per week) to reflect your necessary college credit requirements. If the intern could hold the position very well, we may be able to offer a more full or part-time position with compensation.

Intern, Artificial Intelligence Job Description Rockwell Automation is the largest company in the world dedicated to industrial automation and information. Here, we connect the imaginations of people with the potential of technology to make the world more intelligent, more connected and more productive. From improving the production of medicines that boost human health to reducing waste in an oil and gas plant, the work we do changes how we live. We truly believe we are doing things never before possible. And we need the brightest minds to help make that happen the makers, the forward thinkers, the problem solvers. Thats where you come in. The Strategic Development group at Rockwell Automation has an intern position available for a self-driven individual to participate in the development of monitoring and diagnostics solutions at the edge. A key target for monitoring and diagnostics is rotary machinery (such as motors). We have 2 types of opportunities: * Vision-related intern: The intern will participate in adding functional modules to an AI-driven vision system that is in use in manufacturing operations. These functional modules include development of the web UI and backend ML modules that enhance the performance of the AI engine. * Electromechanically systems interns: The intern will participate in the development of the adaptive algorithms that modify the controller tuning in response to the identified anomalous operating condition of the electromechanical system. The ideal intern will have be familiar with motion applications. Skills you have * Knowledge of electro-mechanical systems (including control). * Knowledge of ML algorithms for image processing * Experience with Typescript and Angular (or aptitude to learn it quickly) to build necessary user interface (Raspberry PI, Nvidia edge devices, ). * Experience with Python. * Comfortable with setting up experimental test beds * Familiarity with Digital Signal Processing * Familiarity with machine learning fundamentals (clustering, regression, etc) Basic Qualification * Must be pursuing a bachelors or advanced degree from an accredited college or university * Preference given to candidates pursuing Masters or PHD degrees * Minimum cumulative GPA of 2.75 * Legal authorization to work in the US is required. We will not sponsor individuals for employment visas, now or in the future, for this job opening. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer including disability and veterans. If you are an individual with a disability and you need assistance or a reasonable accommodation during the application process, please contact our services team at #43;1 (844) 404-7247.

This is an on-going OPEN position. Interns can start or end at any time. At the end of your internship with us, we may offer you a paid position. 

Your training, tasks, and projects will be sent to you remotely via email or through Skype or online meetings - you do NOT need to be in San Diego. 

The days and hours you work for us are up to you. When you start and when you conclude your internship are also up to you. You can work as many hours in any given day as you wish, and at any time of the day. You can work anywhere from about 10 to about 38 hours a week, as per your desire and availability. There will be tasks we’ll give you where we’ll ask that you finish by a certain deadline. You can work remotely (e.g. your home office) for all of the hours; we don’t need you to come to a San Diego office. 

Objective – Gain effective public speaking skills to grow your interpersonal communication skills and confidence, and share the good news of our tours. 

Tasks may include: Via phone, contact various hotel concierges and educate them about San Diego Beer, Wine & Spirits Tours. If you are local to San Diego we may ask you to go in person to the hotel concierges, and networking events. 

Objective – Build an understanding of how to be a public relations (PR) liaison. 

Tasks may include: Correspond, via email and phone, with press/media, which could include writing press releases and social media posts. 

Objective – Obtain knowledge and perform a variety of administrative tasks and computer database functions. 

Tasks may include: Assist in computer database work and customer relationship database (CRM). 

Please answer the following questions: 

1. When can you start and when do you need to conclude your internship? 

2. Do you need anything from us (e.g. reports from us sent to your school)? 

3. How many hours a week would you like to work for us? 

4. Will your work will be remote (this is acceptable); or are you local and able to work in our La Jolla (15 minutes from downtown San Diego) office? 

5. What is your phone number and email address? 

NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE. 

Thank you!

Senior Compensation Analyst (417052) Job Description Senior Compensation Analyst (Job Number: 417052) Description Kindred Healthcare is recruiting a Senior Compensation Analyst to join our Total Rewards (Human Resources) Department. Position may be filled at a higher level based on a candidate's qualifications. Preferred location is Louisville, KY, but willing to consider remote candidates in regional locations. Flexible work schedule available. Summary: Designs, counsels and implements compensation programs to support the Company's goals and competitive practices. Consults with Support Center/division management to refine salary administration programs, provides direction/assistance on salary administration issues, ensures compliance with the Fair Labor Standards Act and other applicable laws. Researches issues and trends, develops, and recommends policies and procedures for compensations issues. Essential Functions: Evaluates jobs within established time frame and mentors less experienced staff in evaluating job and survey process. Reviews and evaluates job descriptions, including feedback of recommended changes and salary range and exemption status assignments. Consults with Department Heads and Managers on issues relative to restructuring their respective department, including titles, salary ranges/grades, job documentation, promotions, etc. Conducts internal pay analysis to ensure adherence with Company policies and guidelines and applicable statutes and regulations. Key partner in merit adminsitration, STI and LTI creation and communication, executive compensation and other compensation projects. Integral partner in the creation and review/audit of Board presentation. Conducts internal equity analysis and makes recommendations within established guidelines to ensure consistency in pay practices. Assists with the development and implementation of salary administration policies and procedures. Provides compensation counseling and analysis relative to mergers, acquisitions and divestitures. Maintain ongoing audits aimed at process improvement, compliance, equity, administrative consistency, etc. Assists with salary survey analysis to determine if specific positions should be reviewed or salary structures updated. Drafts communication and training materials for use by Support Center and Division management to use when discussing Salary Administration and compensation programs with their staff. Trains management on salary administration policies and procedures, performance management, incentive programs, etc. Partners with HR-I/S on issues relative to Salary Administration, including system configuration and/or wage/hour issues that arise due to system changes in the Company. Assists clients with annual merit process, including training and analysis regarding how performance ratings relate to merit increases. Advises Recruiting Department on position requisitions and salary offers. Stay abreast of industry trends and best practices. Knowledge/Skills/Abilities: Sound knowledge of FLSA, Title VII, Wage and Hour, EEOC. Strong computer skills, including Excel, Access, Word. SAPskills preferred. Strong interpersonal, analytical, and organizational skills. Ability to work with large data sets and ensure accuracy with attention to detail. Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality. Qualifications Education: Bachelors degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field. Licenses/Certification: CCP or completion of classes towards obtainment of CCP preferred. Experience: 5-7 years of significant compensation experience in a matrix organization, preferably in a healthcare, insurance or managed care environment. Depending on Candidate's qualifications we may fill this at a different level. We have ranked a best place to work for women, millennials, and in technology nationwide by Fortune Magazine as well as #1 or #2 in The Tampa Bay Top Workplaces Survey for the last six years.

ABOUT THE PROGRAM

KnowBe4's Sales Career Accelerator is a 6-month virtual training and professional development program for college Juniors and Seniors that are interested in pursuing a career in sales. Through this program, students will enter the industry with practical skills, knowledge and experience.

Please note that this program is 100% virtual, is informational in nature, and does not carry any job duties or responsibilities. Participants will not be paid. Participation in the program does not guarantee any future employment with KnowBe4.

Learn New Skills

Learn the processes and systems that top Silicon Valley companies use to create and maintain growth
Learn what top companies look for in sales reps and how to get hired after college

Network With Recruiters & Senior Leaders

Meet the Chief Revenue Officer of KnowBe4
Learn from several SVPs and VPs of Sales
Network directly with KnowBe4's Recruitment team

Grow Your Existing Skills

Get hands-on practice under the guidance of KnowBe4's top sales reps and executives
Work with other students to improve your sales skills together

Improve Your Chance of Getting Hired

80% of the students in last year's program were hired for sales positions (summer internships or full-time career positions)
Upgrade your resume to help you land your dream job
Top performers will get a chance to become interns or employees at KnowBe4

SCHEDULE

Sessions take place from 4:30-6:00 pm (EST) on the
first and third Wednesday of each month from November to April.

Submit your application and resume below.
Once you submit your resume and application, you will receive an email with instructions on how to submit a video. We ask that you submit an application video (no longer than 5 minutes in length) to express your interest in the program and starting a career in sales.
If you move to the next round, you will be scheduled for an interview with the recruitment team and sales executives at KnowBe4.
Decisions will be made on a rolling basis.
The top 20 students will be selected for the program by October 2021.

Must be a Junior or Senior pursuing a degree in Business, Marketing, Sales, or a related major.
Must possess a strong interest in a sales career at a fast-growing software company.
Must have access to a computer and internet connection, with a webcam and the ability to connect to virtual sessions via Zoom.

PROGRAM REQUIREMENTS

Must have an attendance rate of 80% or above in order to graduate from the program.

Note: An applicant assessment and background check may be part of your hiring procedure.

Island Residential Services, is a leading and cutting edge Contracting company on Oahu, is looking for motivated sales professionals to join our team. Based in our Kapolei showroom, you will be responsible to greet customers, answer phone inquiries, demonstrate and present our products in the showroom or scheduled in-home appointments. You can create your own schedule outside of the typical 40 hour work weeks that most people are used to.

This is an opportunity to build a rewarding career at an established and growing company with an exceptional commission plan. You will be working with a highly skilled and experienced team which has a long history of happy customers.

Experience should include either 3 years of proven direct sales experience or a similar period in the construction industry. No cap to how much you can earn. Some of our current sales team even exceed $100,000 per year. You must be self-motivated, professional, fueled by success, eager to earn a six-figure income, be willing to work flexible hours including evenings and weekends when homeowners are available. Cold calling may be necessary as our marketing team helps bring candidates in but you are responsible for your clientele.

The successful candidate must have reliable transportation, no prior felony convictions, be computer literate, dedicated, persistent, and have excellent communication skills along with a positive go-getter attitude. There is a sales incentive based on the income of the project, Most incentives will be derived from commission sales.

SHOULD BE ABLE TO MEET CLIENTS LOCALLY, VISIT HOMES, ASSIST WITH DESIGN AND PRODUCE A PROPOSAL.

Looking to hire right away so apply now!

*Amount earned depends on motivation, work ethic, people skills, and sales skills

Benefits:

Professional development assistance
Company contribution towards medical insurance
Office Computers, necessary software, office space
Sales training to help ensure your success

Work Location:

Client’s homes across Oahu
Office locations in Kapolei, HI
Flexibility to also work remotely

Qualifications:

Residential remodeling sales - (3 years preferred)
Understand architectural plans
Self-motivated, strong in communications and people skills
Proficiency with Microsoft Office - (Outlook, Word & Excel)

Essential Functions:

Work closely with our estimator and production team
Develop and present concept designs, job scope, and proposed construction schedules to our homeowners
Attend design team meetings
Edit final construction agreements
Ensure client satisfaction during construction, including periodic site visits

Other Skills Required:

Friendly, positive attitude – loves interacting with people
Ability to measure rooms

If you presently own a design firm, remodeling business, or manage new home sales and no longer want to do it all yourself, this may be an excellent opportunity for you.

If you love improving how homeowners live in their homes, we want to talk to you. Give us a call, let’s have a conversation.

About Us:

Island Residential is a Local Remodeling and Contracting Company that is growing at a rapid pace.

Learn more about us and see the portfolio of our work at www.islandresidential.net

How to Apply:

In order to be considered for this position, please include the following:

Resume
Cover letter explaining what interests you the most about this position and company.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time, Contract, Temporary, Internship

Pay: $40,000.00 - $125,000.00 per year

Benefits:

401(k)
Flexible schedule
Life insurance
Work from home

Commission pay

Education:

High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Driver's License (Preferred)

On the road

Work Remotely:

No
